titles: Academy. By the Kings priviledge. The most curious and profitable engine that ever was invented, is that which the Kings Majesty hath given leave to John Wells to establish thorowout all England by vertue of his letters patents sealed with the Great Seal of England, forbidding all other persons to undertake, make, or imitate the same, under the penalty specified in the said letters patents, without the power and leave of the aforesaid John Wells. By the means of the foresaid machine, composed of artificial horses, ...
author: Wells, John, fl. 1675.
notes: Title from caption and first lines of text.
Reproduction of original in the Bodleian Library.
